body.p:
i received your letter yesterday with the 10 dollr dollar and the one on friday Friday with the 2 i shall keep the ten to move with it comes very good we shall move the last of june June so walt you can send your next weeks week's letter the same as this and after that i will write how to direct) i am glad Walt you keep well that is the greatest blessing after all) i fell feel quite smart considering i have to work so very hard i feel when i lie down at night as if i should not be able to get up in the morning but when morning comes i feel better matty and sis has gone to woodbridge Woodbridge new jersey near perth amboyPerth Amboy to see if she can get board i dont don't much expect she will get any place but would be very glad if she does she is not very well and the young ones never was half so much trouble i dont don't think in their lives as they are now their mother says she dont don't know what to doo do with them matty worked on the machine and has had a bad coughf cough i think her working on the machine so steady hurt her i wanted her to stop but she wanted to get so much done but she is much better now only has a slight coughf) cough) george is at work on the new main as they call it as inspector i beleive believe that s that's what they call it he stands it midling middling well it is standing and walking but yesterday he had to walk very far to get here he was where he couldent couldn't ride his legs troubles him some get lame he was here to breakfast this morning but
felt as if he would like to loaf and live at his ease there was no particular need as i told him of his going to work so soon but he seemed inclined to doo do so i shall be glad when i get down town on his account it is so far up here he has had a wonderfull wonderful appetite after being sick but its it's not so good now but that is nothing strange his face dont don't appear to bloat any more we have letters from Jeff quite often he worries very much about matti and the children and mammy i told mat to not write every thing to worry him it would doo do us no good but you know how mat is she has certainly not had a beginning of work to doo do but she has felt not very well and very fretful fretful it is amusing to see the folks wach watch us to see if we make any preperations preparations to move but nary a word doo do they speak i dont don't think they would be quite so bad if mrs beecher hadent hadn't given them directions the other day the girl went out and they tied one door with a rope and locked the other edd went down to get a pail of water but couldent couldn't get in i told him to go to the hydrant matt said he shouldent shouldn't so she went down stairs and got the key i should move if the place was finished as small as it is but it has to be painted and it would be so bad but i think i would be very much better of off there than here the place has had very many improvements

postscript.p: i am very sorry for the OconnorsO'Connors very indeed
